description.narrative:
The P4C#s Promoting Gender Equality and Women#s social-economic Empowerment in Agago district of Northern Uganda address the human-rights, governance and equity issues such as mass displacement, including high levels of SGBV, suicide, lack of access to education,health services, land disputes and loss of productive assets that greatly affected women disproportionately due to the prolonged war in Northern Uganda. The project approach is to target women, youth, men, and representatives of local to ensureto have societal buy-in of the strategy of the various interest groups and key stakeholders and to establish strong linkages and partnerships with the Government, financial institutions, private sector, and the civil society as to accelerate project gains, and sustain project impact.
The project aims to bring about significant and sustainable improvements in women#s social status, economic productivity and participation, politico-legal awareness and improved access to property and other rights. The objectives include: 1. Mobilise and build the capacity of at least 800 women for taking up action to realize their rights and entitlements, 2. Undertake economic activities to improve their livelihoods and increasingly participate in decision making in domestic and public spheres##. 3. Increase household incomes and reduced dependence on violent providers (economic empowerment) 4. Advocate for quality public services and accessing justice and redressing grievances and will be realizing their rights and entitlements (political and legal empowerment) 5. Mobilise andbuild capacity of individual and organized action to address persistence exclusion and violence, access entitlements/social services and exercise greater ownership over resources within one year (social empowerment)

participating-org.narrative:
The decades-long conflict in northern Uganda caused by the Lord#s Resistance Army (LRA) insurgency disproportionately impacted women, increasing their vulnerability and marginalization. This compounded the disparity for women as they continued to experience inequities associated with traditional society, but were also obliged to take on new burdens and responsibilities within families and thecommunity especially as family breadwinners and community leaders. During the conflict, sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV) waswidespread, with violations against women and men carried out predominantly by combatants. Its was on the basis of the above that Passion4Community Development organisation was Funded by a vision groups of both lacal and internation people. The Started as a Comunity Based Organisation in 2008 and later registered as a national organistion in the year 2011. Gender has been an integral aspect of the organisation right from the start. The organisation has grown from less than 5 staff from the time it started to now over 10 staff in the recent.
2. ACHIEVEMENTS What have been the principal results in the past three years that contribute to significant, structural, sustained and positive improvement in the lives of men, women, girls and boys suffering from poverty, injustice, insecurity and exclusion?
# The organization has provided legal support to women, youth and girls
# Provided social economic support to women, and youth through livelihoods, business and entrepreneurship support
# Provided educational suport to young girls and boys
3. INSTITUTIONAL PURPOSE The Vision: A society where young people are able to build their potential free from exploitation abuse and lead a productive life.
Mission Statement: Changing the lives of the young people to make a difference by encouraging them, building their capacity to be innovative, creative and hence self reliance.
Mission: What is the current purpose of the organisation? Changing the lives of the young people and womento make a difference by encouraging them, building their capacity to be innovative, creative and hence self reliance.
Institutional objectives: What are the principal changes the organisation seeks to achieve over the long term? # To promote gender equity for sustainable development # To prevent and respond to SGBV to build a protective environment #To strengthen the economic capacity of women and young girls
Field(s) of activity: A)What are the principal thematic and geographic areas in which the organisation works? P4C work in the areas of: Gender equality, Social-economic empowerment, and Protection. The geographical area is northern Uganda
Who are the social actors that benefit from the work?: Women and girls, children and youth
4. STRATEGIC POSITIONING Analyse the environment in which the organisation works? Who are the other relevant social actors, including government and business, and what roles do they play? #In this context, what is unique about the position of the organisation?
a)Who are the other relevant social actors, including government and business, and what roles do they play?
Other relevant social actors Role The Community Receive and take part in the project Local leaders Community authority holders and help in community mobilization The district Provide mandate for the project intervention, coordination and monitoring of the project The duty bearers Legal support and protection. Ensures rule of law Other NGOs and development partners Coordination of work
b) what is unique about the position of the organisation? The organisation has been existing for long working in the areas and very well understands the geographical, cultural, stakeholder#s interests of the area. The organisation has enough technical expertise and logistic to implement the project, Its has good experience in beneficiaries empowerment. The organisation is accountable and transparent, it ensures efficiency and effectiveness.
